section.name: Dataset
section.definition: Names (URLs) and times of recorded data files. Datasets are obtained during a Recording and may belong to different Experiments. Related sections that can be used as subsections, parent sections, or siblings are Stimulus, HardwareSettings, and Experiment.

property.name: Start
property.definition: The point in time the recording of this dataset was started.

property.name: End
property.definition: The point in time the recording of this dataset was ended.

property.name: StartDate
property.definition: The date recording of this dataset was started.

property.name: EndDate
property.definition: The date the recording of this dataset was ended.

property.name: StartTime
property.definition: The local time recording was started.

property.name: EndTime
property.definition: The local time recording was ended.

property.name: Comment
property.definition: A comment about the dataset (common to all files belonging to this dataset).

property.name: File
property.definition: Data of this dataset. Be aware that including the actual content of a data file by this property will blow up the the size of the metadatafile. We rather recommend to simply refer to the URL of a dataset file using the FileURL property.

property.name: Quality
property.definition: A rough indication of the overall quality of the dataset. E.g. poor, fair, or good.

property.name: QualityRange
property.definition: A comma separated ascending list of all used values for indicating the overall quality of the dataset. E.g. "poor,fair,good".
